doc:
Shirley Ross https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shirley_Ross 0 Shirley Ross (born Bernice Maude Gaunt, January 7, 1913 – March 9, 1975) was an American actress and singer, notable for her duet with Bob Hope, "Thanks for the Memory" from The Big Broadcast of 1938. She appeared in 25 feature films between 1933 and 1945, including singing earlier and wholly different lyrics for the Rodgers and Hart song in Manhattan Melodrama (1934) that later became "Blue Moon." Shirley_Ross ( born Bernice_Maude_Gaunt , January_7_,_1913 – March_9_,_1975 ) was an_American_actress_and_singer , notable for her_duet with Bob_Hope , " Thanks for the_Memory " from The_Big_Broadcast of 1938 . She appeared in 25_feature_films between 1933_and_1945 , including singing earlier and wholly_different_lyrics for the_Rodgers_and_Hart_song in Manhattan_Melodrama_(_1934_) that later became " Blue_Moon .
